intro: Heloniopsis japonica var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered Japanese bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and long blooming period.
